info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 10:00AM EST until January 07 at 4:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Lake effect snow with blowing and drifting snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches bringing total snow accumulations as high as 15 to 20 inches from Riverside to Indian Lake with lesser amounts elsewhere. * WHERE...Cass and Berrien Counties. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel will likely continue to be very difficult or impossible in the northern sections of Berrien and Cass Counties, especially over unplowed roads. Stay home if you can. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The lake effect snow band has weakened, but will continue to bring snow through much of the day. Winds from the west at 10 to 20 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow. Wind chill values will remain well below zero into early afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, blankets, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
